did.unittitle: Anonymous letter to George T. Edwards
did.abstract: Letter from a Kentuckian (sender's name illegible) to Edwards in which the writer discusses his debts and poverty, his expectations for obtaining a government position, and the illness of Henry Clay.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

prefercite.p: Anonymous letter to George T. Edwards, 1852, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

processinfo.p: This finding aid was derived from a MARC record using a crosswalk defined in marc2ead_sectionA.xsl. The finding aid was generated as part of a larger project to digitize several thousand small collections housed in Section A, September 2018.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: Judge and state senator from Russellville, Logan County, Kentucky.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Letter from a Kentuckian (sender's name illegible) to Edwards in which the writer discusses his debts and poverty, his expectations for obtaining a government position, and the illness of Henry Clay.

odd.p: Cataloged from card file; description dates from 1973.
